item.title: VIEW 中国第二季度经济增速低于预期
item.description: 周一的数据显示，中国经济在第二季度有所放缓，原因是长期的房地产低迷和就业不稳定拖累了国内需求，使人们继续预期中国政府将需要释放更多刺激政策。【原文：China's economy slowed in the second quarter, data showed on Monday, as a protracted property downturn and job insecurity weighed on domestic demand, keeping alive expectations Beijing will need to unleash more stimulus.】

item.title: 中国第二季度 GDP 同比增长 4.7%，低于预期
item.description: 周一的官方数据显示，中国第二季度经济同比增长4.7%，低于分析师的预期，尽管在房地产长期低迷的情况下，决策者仍在寻求提振内需。【原文：China's economy expanded 4.7% in the second quarter from a year earlier, official data showed on Monday, missing analysts' expectations, even as policymakers seek to boost domestic demand amid a protracted property downturn.】

item.title: 中国 6 月新房价格创 9 年最快降幅
item.description: 周一的官方数据显示，6月份中国新房价格创下约9年来的最快降幅，尽管政府采取了控制供应过剩和增强信心的支持措施，但这个饱受打击的行业仍在努力寻找底部。【原文：China's new home prices fell at the fastest pace in around nine years in June, official data showed on Monday, with the battered sector struggling to find a bottom despite government support measures to control oversupply and bolster confidence.】

item.title: 中国央行一如预期维持中期利率不变
item.description: 周一，中国央行在展期到期的中期贷款时，如期维持中期利率不变。【原文：China's central bank left a medium-term rate unchanged as expected on Monday when rolling over maturing medium-term loans.】

item.title: 澳大利亚银行将向低收入客户返还 1900 万美元的高额费用
item.description: 澳大利亚四家银行将向低收入客户返还总计 2,800 万澳元（1,895 万美元）的资金，因为企业监管机构在审查后发现，这些客户尽管有资格购买更便宜的产品，但却被保留在高收费的银行账户中。【原文：Four Australian banks will give back a total of A$28 million ($18.95 million) to low-income customers, after a review by the corporate regulator found these customers had been kept in high-fee bank accounts despite being eligible for cheaper products.】

item.title: 阿根廷将从央行购买 15 亿美元用于支付 1 月到期的债券利息
item.description: 阿根廷经济部周日表示，将从央行购买略高于 15 亿美元的资金，用于支付该国 2025 年 1 月到期的 "Globales "和 "Bonares "债券的全部利息。【原文：Argentina's economy ministry said on Sunday it will purchase just over $1.5 billion from the central bank to pay the total interest on the country's "Globales" and "Bonares" bonds due in January 2025.】

item.title: 美元获得避险收益；日元下滑仍受干预观察
item.description: 周一，在美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普被暗杀未遂事件发生后，美元因安全买盘而上涨，这反过来又使日元在东京疑似干预的努力下仍难以维持。【原文：The dollar rose on safety bids on Monday in the wake of the attempted assassination of former U.S. President Donald Trump, which in turn left the yen struggling to stay afloat despite Tokyo's suspected intervention efforts.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求激增，台积电第二季度利润大增 30
item.description: 台湾中芯国际集成电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , the main producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 30% rise in second-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to soaring demand.】

item.title: 第二季度中国经济增速放缓，刺激经济的呼声渐高
item.description: 由于房地产长期低迷和就业不稳定拖累了国内需求，中国经济在第二季度可能放缓，这使人们继续预期中国政府将需要采取更多刺激措施。【原文：China's economy likely slowed in the second quarter as a protracted property downturn and job insecurity weighed on domestic demand, keeping alive expectations Beijing will need to unleash more stimulus.】

item.title: 工厂倒闭和中国廉价进口产品导致泰国经济面临动荡
item.description: 本月早些时候，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪在泰国开设了其在东南亚的首家工厂，这个拥有 6600 万人口的国家因此而备受瞩目，其工业远见也赢得了赞誉。【原文：When Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD opened its first Southeast Asian factory in Thailand earlier this month, the nation of 66 million people basked in the limelight and won praise for its industrial vision.】

item.title: 市场关注美国政治，国债下跌，美元坚挺
item.description: 周一，美国债券期货下滑，美元走强，因为投资者押注对美国总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普的攻击使他更有可能获胜，同时给市场注入了全新的政治不确定性。【原文：U.S. bond futures slipped and the dollar firmed on Monday as investors wagered the attack on U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump made his victory more likely, while injecting a whole new level of political uncertainty into markets.】

item.title: 早间新闻特朗普枪击案为市场蒙上阴影，中国 GDP 成为焦点
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 在美国和澳大利亚的推动下，为太平洋岛屿提供世界银行美元生命线的工作继续进行
item.description: 在美国和澳大利亚的支持下，世界银行正在为太平洋岛国准备一条金融生命线，因为西方银行纷纷撤离这个无利可图的市场，引发了人们对中国可能填补这一战略地区真空的担忧。【原文：The World Bank is preparing a financial lifeline for Pacific Island nations, backed by the U.S. and Australia, as an exodus of Western banks from the unprofitable market prompts concern that China could fill the vacuum in the strategic region.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，谷歌母公司接近以 230 亿美元收购网络安全初创公司 Wiz
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日援引知情人士的话报道，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 正在就以约 230 亿美元的价格收购网络安全初创公司 Wiz 进行深入谈判。【原文：Google parent Alphabet is in advanced talks to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for roughly $23 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 报告称瑞士当局在瑞士信贷调查中遭到抨击
item.description: 据瑞士一家报纸周日报道，一份关于瑞士信贷银行 2023 年倒闭事件的议会报告中的初步调查结果显示，瑞士监管当局在导致该银行倒闭的过程中存在严重失误。【原文：Preliminary findings in an eagerly awaited parliamentary report into the 2023 collapse of Credit Suisse have identified serious failings by Swiss regulatory authorities leading up the bank's demise, a Swiss newspaper reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：高盛在压力测试后挑战美联储要求其持有更多资本的要求
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周日援引知情人士的话报道称，高盛已向美国联邦储备委员会提出上诉，质疑其在监管机构最近一次 "压力测试 "中的结果。【原文：Goldman Sachs has lodged an appeal with the U.S. Federal Reserve challenging its result in the regulator's most recent "stress test", which is set to force the bank to hold a greater amount of capital, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 投资者称枪击案后特朗普获胜交易将膨胀
item.description: 投资者周日表示，周六发生在美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普竞选集会上的枪击事件提高了他赢回白宫的几率，未来一周押注他获胜的交易将增加。【原文：Saturday's shooting at U.S. former President Donald Trump's election rally raises his odds of winning back the White House, and trades betting on his victory will increase this coming week, investors said on Sunday.】

item.title: 投资者对特朗普选举集会发生枪击事件的反应
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周六在宾夕法尼亚州的竞选集会上耳朵中弹，当局称这是一起未遂暗杀事件。特朗普的竞选团队表示，事发后他并无大碍。【原文：Donald Trump was shot in the ear during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday in what authorities said they were treating as an assassination attempt. Trump's campaign said he was fine after the incident.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克表示完全支持 "强硬 "的特朗普，并发布照片
item.description: 特斯拉公司首席执行官、亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克说，他 "完全支持 "唐纳德-特朗普，称这位共和党总统候选人 "强硬"。【原文：Elon Musk, the billionaire CEO of Tesla, said he "fully endorsed" Donald Trump, calling the Republican presidential candidate "tough."】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》报道：OpenAI 举报人要求美国证券交易委员会调查限制性保密协议
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》周六报道，OpenAI 的举报人已向美国证券交易委员会提出申诉，要求对这家人工智能公司涉嫌限制性的保密协议进行调查。【原文：OpenAI whistleblowers have filed a complaint with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, calling for an investigation over the artificial intelligence company's allegedly restrictive non-disclosure agreements, the Washington Post reported on Saturday, citing a copy of the letter sent to the SEC.】

item.title: 阿根廷部长表示停止扩大货币基础以降低通胀率
item.description: 阿根廷经济部长路易斯-卡普托（Luis Caputo）周六在信息平台 X 上表示，阿根廷将停止扩大货币基础，作为政府抗击通货膨胀行动的一部分。【原文：Argentina will cease expanding its monetary base as part of the government's campaign to combat inflation, Economy Minister Luis Caputo said on messaging platform X on Saturday.】

item.title: 波音开始与美国联邦航空局（FAA）进行 777X 认证试飞，Air Current 表示
item.description: 据《时事航空》（The Air Current）周五晚些时候报道，波音公司在美国航空监管机构的陪同下正式开始对777-9进行飞行测试，标志着认证程序向前迈进了一步。【原文：Boeing formally began flight testing of the 777-9 with U.S. aviation regulators onboard, The Air Current reported late on Friday, marking a step forward in the certification process.】

item.title: 国营媒体称，抢购中国国债的机构是在做空经济
item.description: 中国央行支持的《金融时报》周六援引业内人士和专家的观点报道称，抢购中国国债的金融机构基本上是在做空中国经济。【原文：Financial institutions snapping up Chinese government bonds are basically shorting the Chinese economy, China's central bank-backed Financial News reported on Saturday, citing what it said were the views of industry sources and experts.】

item.title: 中国商务部副部长会见沃尔玛首席执行官麦克雷
item.description: 中国商务部在一份声明中说，中国商务部副部长王受文周五会见了沃尔玛公司首席执行官凯瑟琳-麦克莱（Kathryn McLay）。【原文：China's Vice Minister of Commerce Wang Shouwen met the chief executive officer of Walmart Inc , Kathryn McLay, on Friday, the commerce ministry said in a statement.】

item.title: 越南 VinFast 因市场放缓推迟在美国建电动汽车工厂
item.description: 由于全球电动汽车市场的不确定性，越南电动汽车（EV）制造商 VinFast 计划将其价值 40 亿美元的北卡罗莱纳州工厂的投产时间推迟到 2028 年，并将今年的交付量预期下调 20,000 辆。【原文：Vietnamese electric vehicle (EV) maker VinFast is delaying the launch of its planned $4 billion factory in North Carolina to 2028 and cutting its delivery forecast for this year by 20,000 units amid uncertainties in the global EV market.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美国降息预期令投资者将目光投向大型科技公司之外
item.description: 迫在眉睫的美国降息给投资者带来了一个艰难的选择：是坚持持有一年多来推动回报的大型科技股，还是转向市场中不太受青睐的、可能从宽松货币政策中受益的领域。【原文：Looming U.S. interest rate cuts are presenting investors with a tough choice: stick with the Big Tech stocks that have driven returns for more than a year or turn to less-loved areas of the market that could benefit from easing monetary policy.】

item.title: 韩国 SK On 正在洽谈供应棱柱形电动汽车电池，寻求扭亏为盈
item.description: 韩国电动汽车（EV）电池制造商 SK On 的一位高管表示，该公司正在与汽车制造商洽谈供应棱柱电池事宜，以扩大现有袋装电池的供应范围，在全球电动汽车（EV）需求放缓的情况下努力扭亏为盈。【原文：South Korean EV battery maker SK On is in talks with automakers to supply prismatic batteries, expanding from its existing pouch-type batteries, a senior executive said, as it scrambles to turn around amid slowing global electric vehicle (EV) demand.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，马斯克向为选举特朗普而努力的超级基金捐款
item.description: 据彭博社周五援引消息人士的话报道，亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）已向一个致力于选举美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的超级慈善组织捐款。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk has donated to a super pac working to elect former U.S. President Donald Trump, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing sources.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会就不公平商业行为向特许经营商发出警告
item.description: 美国贸易监管机构周五宣布了一系列行动，旨在打击品牌所有者非法强加给美国特许经营商的 "不公平和欺骗性做法"，如要求支付特许经营合同中未列出的新费用，或利用合同条款阻止特许经营商与监管机构对话。【原文：A U.S. trade regulator on Friday announced a suite of actions taking aim at "unfair and deceptive practices" it said are illegally imposed on U.S. franchisees by their brand owners, such as requiring new fees not outlined in franchise contracts, or using contract provisions to discourage franchisees from speaking with regulators.】

item.title: 汽车工人工会主席抨击特朗普，称赞拜登但未使用其姓名
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）周五批评了唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的美国总统候选人资格，并赞扬了乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统，但没有使用他的名字，也没有重复工会一月份对他今年秋季连任的支持。【原文：United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain on Friday criticized Donald Trump's U.S. presidential candidacy and praised President Joe Biden without ever using his name or repeating the union's January endorsement for his re-election this fall.】
